clinical_study.brief_title: Electroacupuncture and Trancutaneous Electrical Nervous Stimulation (TENS) for Colonoscopy Analgesia
clinical_study.official_title: Electroacupuncture and Trancutaneous Electrical Nervous Stimulation Analgesia for Colonoscopy: a Prospective, Randomized, Controlled Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Azienda Per I Servizi Sanitari N. 2 Isontina

clinical_study.source: Azienda Per I Servizi Sanitari N. 2 Isontina

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the effectiveness of acupuncture and transcutaneous electrical nervous stimulation (TENS) in reducing patient's discomfort during colonoscopy

detailed_description.textblock: Evaluation patient's pain and discomfort during colonoscopy, using two non invasive analgesic methods.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of patients' discomfort and pain during and at the end of colonoscopy both in acupuncture group and in TENS group compare with controls.
primary_outcome.time_frame: During colonoscopy, we'll evaluate pain at colorectal, left, trasversal and right colon position of colonscope. At the end of colonoscopy, before discharge, we' ll evaluate patient's general discomfort.

arm_group.description: Electrostimulation at 5 Hz in GI4, ST36, MP6, MP9 starting 20 minutes before colonoscopy
Electrostimulation at 5 Hz in GI4, ST36, MP6, MP9 starting 20 minutes before colonoscopy
patient are monitored for pain and discomfort

Electrostimulation at 5 Hz in GI4, ST36, MP6, MP9 starting 20 minutes before colonoscopy
Patients are monitored for pain and discomfort
intervention.other_name: No treatment (only sedative drugs if request)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all patients scheduled for colonoscopy and in whom deep sedation was not planned will be included in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- age > 80 and less than 18 years old, severe cardiac or pulmonary disease, anticoagulant, benzodiazepines, antidepressants, opiates therapies, severe cognitive impairment, uncontrolled hypertension.
